content.raw:
Update: got rid of some warnings in [drcsim_4.2_latest_warnings](#!/osrf/drcsim/commits/11c6cca3b1e4f5817f41466f9f5f260d8dd121e4) branch 

It looks like a `walk_params` data packing issue in actionlib server (used by keyboard_teleop) - not sure if the teams are using this so may not be high priority for now.
content.html:
Update: got rid of some warnings in drcsim_4.2_latest_warnings branch

It looks like a walk_params data packing issue in actionlib server (used by keyboard_teleop) - not sure if the teams are using this so may not be high priority for now.

pullrequest.title: Final changes to make Atlas v4 & v5 stand and walk

content.raw:
Apart from a change to the user camera direction, `drcsim_model_resource/worlds/atlas.world` uses these param for the solver:

~~~
          <iters>200</iters>
          <sor>1.0</sor>
~~~

while `atlas_robot_hands.world` has

~~~
          <iters>50</iters>
          <sor>1.4</sor>
~~~

Not sure if the differences are intended
content.html:
Apart from a change to the user camera direction, drcsim_model_resource/worlds/atlas.world uses these param for the solver:

          <iters>200</iters>
          <sor>1.0</sor>

while atlas_robot_hands.world has

          <iters>50</iters>
          <sor>1.4</sor>

Not sure if the differences are intended

content.raw:
~~~
$ roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_robotiq_hands.launch model_args:="_v5"
... logging to /home/hsu/.ros/log/2b67a7fc-87f1-11e4-84d7-40e23085b399/roslaunch-lcp2-4977.log
Checking log directory for disk usage. This may take awhile.
Press Ctrl-C to interrupt
Done checking log file disk usage. Usage is <1GB.

roslaunch file contains multiple nodes named [/atlas_robot_state_publisher].
Please check all <node> 'name' attributes to make sure they are unique.
Also check that $(anon id) use different ids.
The traceback for the exception was written to the log file
~~~

fix with

~~~
$ hg diff
diff -r e8fd4d57e182 drcsim_gazebo/launch/atlas_robotiq_hands.launch
--- a/drcsim_gazebo/launch/atlas_robotiq_hands.launch   Fri Dec 19 14:38:10 2014 -0800
+++ b/drcsim_gazebo/launch/atlas_robotiq_hands.launch   Fri Dec 19 18:38:59 2014 -0800
@@ -31,6 +31,4 @@
   <param name="robot_initial_pose/yaw"   value="0" type="double"/>
 
   <include file="$(find drcsim_gazebo)/launch/atlas_robotiq_hands_bringup.launch"/>
-
-  <include file="$(find drcsim_gazebo)/launch/atlas$(arg model_args)_bringup.launch"/>
 </launch>
~~~

But the robot does a little bit of slow arm swinging left and right on startup,

![atlas_robotiq_hand_v5.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/bae8oa/images/2655498644-atlas_robotiq_hand_v5.png)

and I got new errors:

~~~
...
[ INFO] [1419043178.586742351, 0.055000000]: Bounds for joint[l_arm_wry] is [0.000000, 125.000000], model default is [0.100000]
[ INFO] [1419043178.586778808, 0.055000000]: Bounds for joint[l_arm_wrx] is [0.000000, 125.000000], model default is [0.100000]

$ roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_robotiq_hands.launch model_args:="_v5"

pullrequest.title: Final changes to make Atlas v4 & v5 stand and walk

content.raw:
I see error messages similar to Jose's when I run keyboard teleop, but Gazebo also crashes. Specifically, I press "i", see the robot lifting its leg to take a step, gazebo crashes.

```
 [AtlasSimInterface] [Atlas3SimRTInterface] unknown variable specified for ocu_set. name='step.step.delayed_trans_state_d'
 [AtlasSimInterface] Atlas3Step_walk.cpp,populate_step_path,198 did not get all the steps I asked for
 [AtlasSimInterface] 	Step(0) asked for 5 and got 1
 [AtlasSimInterface] 	Path Server: user_path_server
 [AtlasSimInterface] 	Trying to find (     1 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    2 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    3 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    4 [AtlasSimInterface] )
 [AtlasSimInterface] 	API Queue has  (     0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] )
 [AtlasSimInterface] Atlas3Step_walk.cpp,185: unknown contact info, could not find step leg
```

The keyboard_teleop python script kept running, though.

On second try, the program did not crash. I didn't see the weird behavior Jose did, but when interrupted walking by pressing "r", it fell over while trying to stop itself. I don't know if this is normal behavior for the keyboard_teleop controller, however.
content.html:
I see error messages similar to Jose's when I run keyboard teleop, but Gazebo also crashes. Specifically, I press "i", see the robot lifting its leg to take a step, gazebo crashes.

 [AtlasSimInterface] [Atlas3SimRTInterface] unknown variable specified for ocu_set. name='step.step.delayed_trans_state_d'
 [AtlasSimInterface] Atlas3Step_walk.cpp,populate_step_path,198 did not get all the steps I asked for
 [AtlasSimInterface]    Step(0) asked for 5 and got 1
 [AtlasSimInterface]    Path Server: user_path_server
 [AtlasSimInterface]    Trying to find (     1 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    2 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    3 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    4 [AtlasSimInterface] )
 [AtlasSimInterface]    API Queue has  (     0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] )
 [AtlasSimInterface] Atlas3Step_walk.cpp,185: unknown contact info, could not find step leg

The keyboard_teleop python script kept running, though.

On second try, the program did not crash. I didn't see the weird behavior Jose did, but when interrupted walking by pressing "r", it fell over while trying to stop itself. I don't know if this is normal behavior for the keyboard_teleop controller, however.
